title: Shakhtar Dontesk youngsters mimic Thierry Henry and Robert Pires's two-man penalty routine
text:
Fourteen years have passed since Robert Pires and Thierry Henry were left red-faced when their two-man penalty routine backfired.

Fast forward to Tuesday night and two Shakhtar Donetsk youngsters showed the Arsenal legends how it is done after pulling off a clever version of their own in the UEFA Youth League match against Atalanta.

While the match finished 2-2, the tandem penalty, scored by Georgy Sudakov, quickly went viral on social media as football fans reminisced about the botched effort back in 2005.

Shakhtar Donetsk pulled off an impressive tandem penalty routine in the UEFA Youth League

The ball was squared to Georgy Sudakov with the Atalanta goalkeeper totally confused

The ball was fired into the net and the clip of the goal quickly went viral across social media

Мудрик ➡ Судаков ⚽ Футболисты «Шахтера» U19 разыграли пенальти в матче Юношеской лиги УЕФА с «Аталантой» U19. pic.twitter.com/2DwAmlH9R0 — ⚒FC SHAKHTAR DONETSK (@FCShakhtar) October 1, 2019

The tandem penalty is rare but has been pulled off successfully before.

Lionel Messi teed up Barcelona team-mate Luis Suarez in 2016 and Johann Cruyff made the routine famous in 1982 when he showcased it with Jesper Olsen.

Pires was the designated taker when he attempted it with Henry but it did not go to plan.

The French midfielder runs with purpose before nudging the ball to the left, only to see two Manchester City players come charging in ahead of Henry to clear.

Robert Pires attempted the tandem penalty with Thierry Henry against Man City back in 2005

A player is not allowed to touch the ball for a second time one they have made first contact, according to the laws of the game, and so in Arsenal's case, Pires had merely brushed the ball with his studs before Henry could reach it.

The routine is perfectly fair and looks spectacular when it is pulled off - as it was by the Shakhtar starlets.

Provided the player taking the penalty kicks the ball forward and he does not play the ball a second time until it has been touched by another player, the effort is legitimate.
